details.description: Stop driving, give up your driving licence
details.body:
There’s no legal age at which you must stop driving. You can decide when to stop, but medical conditions can affect your driving and might mean you give up your driving licence.

When you do decide to stop driving

Tell the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) that you want to give up your driving licence.

If you have a medical condition you’ll need to fill in a ‘Declaration of voluntary surrender’ form.

Download ‘Declaration of voluntary surrender’ (PDF, 35KB)

Send or fax the completed form and your current driving licence to the DVLA.

Check your driving skills

If you want to keep driving but are worried about your ability to do so, speak to your GP.

You can also have your driving assessed in a confidential and objective test from the Royal Society for the Prevention of Accidents (RoSPA).
